articles.title: Congratulations to Syrian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Syrian President
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Bashar Al-Assad upon his re-election as president of Syria.
					 The message extended warm congratulations to him upon his re-election as president of Syria thanks to the support and trust of the Syrian people.
					
					 It said that the election marked an important occasion in the struggle of the Syrian people to meet all challenges of the imperialists and hostile forces and protect the sovereignty and security of the country.
					
					 The message wished the president greater success in his responsible work to build an independent, peaceful and prosperous Syria.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm and Taedonggang Combined Fruit Processing Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm and Taedonggang Combined Fruit Processing Factory
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm and Taedonggang Combined Fruit Processing Factory together with Ri Sol Ju.
					 He looked round the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm.
					
					 He said with deep emotion: "Having come to this farm, I miss great General Kim Jong Il very much and stanza of a song that will he visit the farm again when telling him apple tree flowers are in full bloom comes to my mind."
					
					 Commanding a bird's-eye view of a vast expanse of the fruit farm and modern houses and cultural and welfare facilities nestled at every foot of the hill from the observation deck, he said that they looked like a picturesque socialist land of bliss and an ideal land for people.
					
					 The farm could be successfully built as a large-scale fruit production base thanks to the guidance of leader Kim Jong Il who made devoted efforts to provide the people with more fruits, he noted.
					
					 He set forth tasks to be fulfilled to boost the fruit production.
					
					 Saying that the area under fruit trees created on the farm is vast, he underscored the need to steadily increase the per-hectare yield of fruit in order to decisively boost the fruit production.
					
					 He also underlined the need to put the production of fruits on a high scientific, modern and intensive basis by increasing the role of the farm and the fruit research field. 
					
					 He instructed officials to make sure that the relevant units adequately supply to the farm equipment and materials including machines, herbicides and fertilizers as it is the nation's important fruit producing base.
					
					 Touring the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Processing Factory, he gave an instruction to improve its management.
					
					 Looking back on the day when he visited the factory, accompanying Kim Jong Il, Kim Jong Un said only when the factory keeps its production going at a high rate, is it possible to translate the ardent desire of Kim Jong Il to provide greater quantities of processed fruit to the people into a reality.
					
					 He instructed officials to make dynamic endeavors to steadily increase the technical skills of the employees, scrupulously manage equipment and improve technical control, boost the production of a variety of processed fruits and ensure the quality and sanitary safety on the highest level.
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that all employees of the farm and factory would make energetic efforts to implement the ideas of the party and uphold its policies.
					
					 He was accompanied by Pak Pong Ju, Hwang Pyong So, Ri Jae Il and Choe Hwi.

articles.title: DPRK Hails Formation of National Unity Government in Palestine
articles.content:
DPRK Hails Formation of National Unity Government in Palestine
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA Thursday as regards the formation of the national unity government in Palestine:
					 The national unity government consisting of the Palestine National Liberation Movement (Fatah) and the Palestine Islamic Resistance Movement (Hamas), major political forces of Palestine, was formed on June 2.
					
					 We welcome the establishment of the national unity government of Palestine and estimate the efforts of Fatah and Hamas for the national reconciliation and unity.
					
					 We hope that the new government will regain as soon as possible the legitimate rights of the Palestinian people including the right to build an independent state with Kuds as its capital city by their concerted efforts.

articles.title: Spokesman for C.C., DPRK Red Cross Society Urges Again S. Korean Side to Send Crewmen of DPRK Side Back
articles.content:
Spokesman for C.C., DPRK Red Cross Society Urges Again S. Korean Side to Send Crewmen of DPRK Side Back
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society  released a statement on Thursday denouncing the south Korean authorities' unethical action.
					 Crewmen of the DPRK met distress in the East Sea of Korea recently while fishing.
					
					 In this regard the DPRK side demanded the south Korean authorities send three distressed crewmen of the DPRK and their fishing boat back immediately.
					
					 But the south Korean authorities repatriated one crewman only via Panmunjom and unreasonably held two crewmen in custody, asserting "they expressed their will to defect" and the like.
					
					 The DPRK side immediately sent a notice strongly urging the south side once again to send the two crewmen back  and demanding it bring them to Panmunjom and let them meet face-to-face with a representative of  the DPRK side if "their intention is true".
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean authorities still keep them in custody, barring them from meeting with a representative of the DPRK side though several days have passed since then.
					
					 This is an unpardonable grave encroachment upon the human rights of the DPRK citizens and its sovereignty and another unethical crime.
					
					 The families of the crewmen who are detained in south Korea are eagerly waiting for their earliest possible safe return to their hometown, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities should unconditionally and immediately send all our unreasonably detained crewmen back.
					
					 If they refuse to do so, we will strongly react against them, as we have already warned, and then they will be held wholly responsible for the ensuing grave consequences.

articles.title: Greetings to King of Sweden
articles.content:
Greetings to King of Sweden
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on June 1 sent a message of greeting to Carl  XVI Gustaf, king of Sweden, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message sincerely wished the people of Sweden prosperity and well-being.

articles.title: Greetings to Malawi President
articles.content:
Greetings to Malawi President
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Arthur Peter Mutharika upon his election as president of Malawi.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing the president of Malawi success in his work for the country's stability and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Palestinian PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Palestinian PM
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Rami Hamdallah upon his election as prime minister of the State of Palestine.
					 The message extended warm congratulations to the prime minister on the recent formation of the national unity government in Palestine.
					
					 Affirming full support and solidarity for the Palestinian people in their just struggle to regain the legitimate national rights including the right to build an independent state with Kuds as its capital city, it wished him bigger success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Mexican Party Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Mexican Party Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) --  A delegation of the Workers' Party of Mexico led by Laura Julieta, member of its National Executive Committee, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The guests looked round historic relics preserved with much care at the old home in Mangyongdae, being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and the patriotic life of his families.
					
					 At the end of the visit, the head of the delegation said that he was pleased to visit the old home in Mangyongdae where Kim Il Sung was born.
					
					 I was deeply moved by the fact that he was born in such a simple family, he noted, adding: 
					
					 The Mexican people boundlessly revere and respect HE Kim Il Sung who performed great feats on behalf of the world revolution.
					
					 The delegation visited the Kim Jong Suk Nursery, Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Palace, Okryu Children's Hospital, etc.

articles.title: Friendship Delegation Leaves for Mongolia
articles.content:
Friendship Delegation Leaves for Mongolia
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- A friendship delegation headed by Im Hun, chairman of the North Hwanghae Provincial People's Committee, left here Thursday to visit Mongolia.

articles.title: Delegation of Youth League Back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of Youth League Back Home
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League led by Jong Yong Won, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, returned home on Thursday after visiting Vietnam and taking part in the meeting of the General Council of the World Federation of Democratic Youth held in Hanoi.

articles.title: DPRK Team Wins at 2014 AFC U-14 Girls Regional Championship for East Region
articles.content:
DPRK Team Wins at 2014 AFC U-14 Girls Regional Championship for East Region
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The DPRK players came first at the 2014 AFC U-14 Girls Soccer Regional Championship for the East Region held in Hebei Province, China from May 30.
					 The championship brought together eight teams from the DPRK, China, Japan and other countries and regions.
					
					 At the group league match the DPRK team defeated its Chinese, Japanese and other rivals.
					
					 It defeated the team of Taipei of China 1:0 at the semi-finals and Japanese team 2:1 at the finals.
					
					 DPRK player Ko Kyong Hui was awarded top scorer's prize at the championship.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Statues and Grave of Kim Hyong Jik
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Statues and Grave of Kim Hyong Jik
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Wreathes were laid before the statue of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement of Korea, in Ponghwa-ri, Kangdong County, Pyongyang and his grave in Mangyongdae on Thursday, the 88th anniversary of his demise.
					 Seen standing before the statue and grave were wreaths sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop and Ro Tu Chol, vice-premiers, chairperson of a friendly party, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel, working people and school youth and children.
					
					 Laid before the statue and grave were wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 Also placed there were wreaths in the name of armed forces organs, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, revolutionary schools and educational institutions, and party and power bodies, enterprises and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence, looking back on the revolutionary career of Kim Hyong Jik who put forward the idea "Aim High" and devoted himself to the country and the nation.
					
					 Wreaths and bouquets were also laid before his statues at Kim Hyong Jik Military Medical University and in Sakju and Junggang counties on the same day.

articles.title: KPA Service Personnel Tour Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
KPA Service Personnel Tour Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
Samjiyon, June 5 (KCNA) -- Service personnel of the Korean People's Army (KPA) made a study tour of revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu. They visited the areas of Pochonbo and Rimyongsu.
					 The members of the study tour group who arrived at Pochonbo from Hyesan, Ryanggang Province on June 1 laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung standing on the side of Karim stream and paid tribute to him.
					
					 They were briefed on the Pochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site.
					
					 On June 2 they visited the Pochonbo Revolutionary Museum before going round Konjang Hill, Kusi Barrage, the command post for the Battle of Pochonbo, the then police post of the Japanese imperialists, the subcounty office and other places.
					
					 They held a bonfire gathering that evening.
					
					 Om Hyang Chol, chairman of the KPA Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, addressing the gathering, underscored the need to make sure that the flames which raged in Pochonbo will lead to the flames of the struggle for devotedly defending the leader and the country and for bringing the final doom to imperialism and achieving a victory in the great war for national reunification under the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A shooting contest of the service personnel of the KPA who participated in the study tour took place in Pochonbo on June 3.
					
					 At a meeting to vow to take revenge upon the U.S. imperialists and the Park Geun Hye puppet group held prior to the contest, they expressed the will to make the enemies face the deadly strikes of the powerful revolutionary Paektusan army as they recklessly hurt the dignity and social system of the DPRK.
					
					 The study tour group arrived at the Spring Site in Poso-ri, went round the spring site visited by leader Kim Jong Il and crossed the Junghung Plateau that evening through an armed forced march.
					
					 It went round the Rimyongsu Revolutionary Site, the Konchang and Chongbong bivouacs and the revolutionary battle site in the Dam No. 5 on June 4 and 5.
					
					 The march to Mt. Paektu will continue.

articles.title: Different Kinds of Medicines Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Different Kinds of Medicines Developed in DPRK
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Different kinds of medicines have been developed by the Pharmacy Research Institute under the Academy of Medical Science in the DPRK.
					 Among them are silymarin tablet and leu-val hepatitis transfusion, which are efficacious against liver diseases.
					
					 They also include amino acids nutrition transfusion and other medicines for coughing, diarrhea, heart disease, cerebral thrombosis, etc.

articles.title: News Analyst on U.S. Policy of "Strategic Patience"
articles.content:
News Analyst on U.S. Policy of "Strategic Patience"
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The U.S. policy of "strategic patience" toward the DPRK, advocated by Obama, has reached its critical point.
					 In the past, the preceding presidents, policy-makers, think-tanks of the United States had resorted to all sorts of carrot-and-stick policy in a bid to force the DPRK to dismantle its nukes, but in vain.
					
					 Nevertheless, Obama employed the "strategic patience" policy, aimed at "nuclear dismantlement" in the DPRK and its "collapse", with an attitude that the final say and time are on the side of the U.S.
					
					 But the reality went against his expectation.
					
					 The first round of nuclear test by the DPRK clearly showed that nukes are not monopoly of the U.S. Then its second and third rounds of nuclear tests made it an established fact that the final say and time in the showdown between the DPRK and the U.S. are by no means on the U.S. side.
					
					 The DPRK's consolidated position as a nuclear weapons state much upset the U.S. It is well illustrated by the developments in the recent one year.
					
					 Last year the U.S. made frantic efforts to isolate and stifle the DPRK over its successful third nuclear test.
					
					 To cope with such grave situation, Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un convened an emergency operation meeting on the KPA Strategic Force's performance of duty for firepower strike at 00:30 on March 29. There he ordered the KPA strategic rockets to be standby for fire so that they may strike any time the U.S. mainland and its military bases in the operational theaters in the Pacific and those in south Korea.
					
					 Taken aback by the KPA Strategic Force's striking plan, Americans expressed fear that the DPRK would reduce the U.S. mainland into ashes.
					
					 In this way, the DPRK responded to a wave of U.S. challenges with its toughest counteractions, while calling for dialogue and peace.
					
					 This year the DPRK has worked hard to create an atmosphere for dialogue and peace, but the U.S. launched Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers by instigating the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 Under such situation, the Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army conducted drills of launching various kinds of rockets and warned that if the U.S. reckless provocation goes beyond tolerance limit, the DPRK's rockets launching drills for self-defense would lead to the most powerful retaliatory rocket attack in a moment.
					
					 The U.S. dared not retort the DPRK's action, making various conjectures.
					
					 In March last, the U.S. Defense Department noted in its annual report on the DPRK's military capabilities that the DPRK has possessed ballistic missiles capable of hitting most areas of the U.S. mainland.
					
					 In this regard, Americans have argued that "strategic patience" is exercised by the DPRK rather than the U.S.
					
					 A U.S. expert on the DPRK's nuclear issue declared that Obama's "strategic patience" policy came to failure, saying it is possible for the DPRK to conduct nuclear test at any time and nuclear chain test, too, in a short period.
					
					 New York Times said that the current deadlock would only give the DPRK time to go on its nuclear program and the situation would get worse if a solution is not made.
					
					 KBS and other media of south Korea, too, said the present situation shows that time is by no means on the side of south Korea and the U.S.
					
					 Now is the time for the present U.S. administration to abandon its anachronistic policy. If it persists in its "strategic patience", the U.S. will meet a miserable end.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Plot to Cook up "North Wind"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Plot to Cook up "North Wind"
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Park Geun Hye group of south Korea in the grip of the worst ruling crisis in the wake of the ferry Sewol disaster is making last-ditch efforts to get rid of it by cooking up "north wind".
					 At a time when the south Korean people are becoming evermore angry due to the Sewol disaster, the south Korean authorities are making desperate efforts to cook up "north wind" such as fiction about "nuclear test in April", "possible provocation of a local war" and "drones from the north". This is part of the sinister political plot to put the situation in the wake of the ferry disaster under control. 
					
					 They have become more frantic in confrontation ruckus since they announced the provocative war scenario against the north called "five-phase military strategy towards the north," in particular. They let military hooligans to unhesitatingly perpetrate such grave military provocation as firing shells at DPRK warships on routine guard duty and Chinese fishing boats in the waters off the five islands on the West Sea of Korea, the biggest hotspot. 
					
					 The conservative groups including the "Saenuri Party" perpetrated such hideous provocation as groundlessly  hurting the dignified system of the DPRK, claiming that the north abuses the Sewol disaster "for a political purpose" and "creates  discord in the south by intensifying agitation against it." They are, at the same time, wooing conservative media into misleading the public opinion to fabricate "north wind". 
					
					 The authorities responsible for making hundreds of passengers including schoolchildren buried at seabed are working hard to evade the responsibility for the tragedy and suppress protesters, far from making sincere apology and repentance for it. They have gone the lengths of perpetrating such thrice-cursed crime as linking even bereaved families to "north wind." 
					
					 The provocative racket kicked up by the Park Geun Hye group against the DPRK with military gangsters and conservative forces involved are nothing but the last-ditch efforts made by those driven into a pretty fix. 
					
					 Forsaken by the people due to its unpopular policy, the Park group is now finding itself in a bottomless quagmire due to the ferry disaster. 
					
					 The south Korean people from all walks of life are now becoming evermore vocal demanding the "resignation of Park Geun Hye." 
					
					 The Park group in the grip of the daily worsening ruling crisis is now seeking a way out of it in intensifying anti-DPRK conspiratorial and confrontation racket. 
					
					 "North wind" much touted by the group is a trite method it employs whenever its ruling crisis gets serious. 
					
					 Its "north wind" ruckus is as foolish an act as precipitating its self-destruction. 
					
					 It is too late for the Park group to save its miserable fate already sealed.

articles.title: Minju Joson Raps Anti-DPRK Remarks of Traitor Kim Kwan Jin
articles.content:
Minju Joson Raps Anti-DPRK Remarks of Traitor Kim Kwan Jin
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Traitor Kim Kwan Jin of south Korea went to Singapore on May 31 where he malignantly slandered the social system of the DPRK while vociferating about "vulnerability", "contradiction" and "instability". Not content with this, he told such rubbish as "illegal trespass on the northern limit line", "sea shelling provocation" and "infiltration of small drones".
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Thursday terms it a treacherous crime to misrepresent the reality in the DPRK, mislead the public opinion and justify the heinous confrontation moves of the south Korean authorities.
					
					 Citing the data to prove why Kim let loose a spate of such belligerent remarks even in a foreign country, the commentary goes on:
					
					 As known, Park Geun Hye dismissed the chief of the security office of Chongwadae and the director of the puppet Intelligence Service, pressurized by the people enraged at the ferry Sewol disaster. Media of south Korea introduced nominees for the chief of the security office of Chongwadae among whom was Kim Kwan Jin. By taking advantage of his visit to Singapore, he, obsessed with the greed for power, made anti-DPRK remarks as intended by Park Geun Hye in a bid to curry favor with her. Just as one thought, Park appointed Kim, a diehard confrontation maniac, to the post on June 1.
					
					 It is as clear as a pikestaff that the north-south relations will be pushed to an extreme catastrophe and the danger of a new war, a nuclear war, will mount on the Korean peninsula as Kim, who is equal to Park in confrontation hysteria, is holding the post of the chief of the security office of Chongwadae that looks after diplomacy and security of south Korea.
					
					 The DPRK regards ridiculous invectives made by Kim as a scream of a mad dog.

articles.title: Minju Joson Observes World Environment Day
articles.content:
Minju Joson Observes World Environment Day
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson Thursday dedicates an article to World Environment Day.
					 Introducing the work for environmental protection in the DPRK, the article notes:
					
					 Pursuant to the policy for environmental protection enforced by the government of the DPRK which regards man as the most valuable being in the world, the Law on Environmental Protection was adopted in the country long ago and a dynamic work has been done to fully meet its provisions.
					
					 Various measures have been taken by the state to conserve forests, prevent contamination of rivers and decrease greenhouse gas emissions.
					
					 Many foreign visitors to the DPRK are unanimous in saying that its cities are kept clean and air is pure.
					
					 Of course, there still remain problems pending solution in the field of environmental protection.
					
					 It is hard to completely solve the issue of the protection of global environment by the efforts of a few countries.
					
					 Concerted efforts of mankind alone can protect the environment of the earth and ensure its sustained development.
					
					 The government of the DPRK will as ever creditably fulfill its national obligation to protect the global environment in cooperation with international bodies.

articles.title: Non-Aligned Movement Is Powerful Independent Forces in Our Era: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Non-Aligned Movement Is Powerful Independent Forces in Our Era: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Non-Aligned Movement is the powerful independent forces against imperialism in our era together with the socialist forces, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The movement has developed into an international movement involving a lot of population and countries of the world. It markedly changed the relations of forces between progressives and reactionaries and greatly encouraged the cause of making the whole world independent.
					
					 In order to realize its pivot to Asia-Pacific strategy based on the policy of strength, the U.S. is tapping all the military potentials and resorting to the high-handed and arbitrary practices and interference in the internal affairs of countries in Europe, Mideast, Latin America and Africa.
					
					 The U.S. military threat has steadily increased on the Korean peninsula, resulting in an unstable situation which is neither war nor peace.
					
					 Frantic war racket and hideous provocations committed by south Korea against the DPRK have gone beyond the tolerance limit and reached a dangerous phase that can no longer be overlooked. 
					
					 The situation calls upon the member nations of NAM to increase their role and strengthen joint actions based on their unity and solidarity in order to smash the evermore undisguised moves of the imperialists and defend sovereignty of countries and nations and regional peace and security.
					
					 Respect for sovereignty, territorial integrity and non-interference in others' internal affairs are the principles to be invariably adhered to by the movement that aspires after an independent and peaceful new world.
					
					 The DPRK, as a member nation of NAM, has made consistent efforts to develop the movement in conformity with the purpose of its founding and the principles of its activities in the idea of independence, peace and friendship-the idea of its foreign policy.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever make all efforts to invariably preserve the noble idea and principles of the movement and develop it, the article stresses.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers to Launch General Strike
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers to Launch General Strike
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Huimang Solidarity Trade Union under the Seoul Regional Headquarters of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a press conference in Seoul on June 2 to declare a strike, according to the south Korean newspaper Nodong and Segye.
					 At the press conference speakers said the company side is mulling cutting down wage 20 percent, adding they can never accept it.
					
					 Wage hike and good working conditions are important, they said, calling for staging actions for the basic rights of the people.
					
					 They warned they would launch a general strike to have the demand of the trade unions met.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Launch Sit-in Strike
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Launch Sit-in Strike
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Members of the crane operators' branch in South Jolla Province of construction trade union launched a sit-in strike on a steel tower in protest against the management's crackdown upon them on June 2 in Ryosu, South Jolla Province of south Korea, according to south Korean newspaper Nodong and Segye.
					 The branch formed in October last year proposed negotiations to the management side, demanding it cut down working hours, ensure rest and stabilize employment of crane operators.
					
					 However, the management side turned down their demand but dismissed core members of the trade union. Moreover, it closed their workshop and axed 15 other members recently.
					
					 Members of the branch are staging sit-in strike on a steel tower in protest against the management side as it is keen on stamping out the trade union in utter disregard of the workers' right to existence.
					
					 The construction trade union declared that it would sponsor a protest meeting of workers from across South Jolla Province in the scene of the sit-in strike on June 5 and stage actions together with all construction workers from across south Korea on June 11.

articles.title: Appointment of Anti-DPRK Confrontation Maniac as Chief of Security Office of Chongwadae Opposed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Appointment of Anti-DPRK Confrontation Maniac as Chief of Security Office of Chongwadae Opposed in S. Korea
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society Monday issued a commentary opposing the appointment of an anti-DPRK confrontation maniac as chief of the security office of Chongwadae.
					 The commentary referred to the fact that the authorities appointed Kim Kwan Jin as chief of the security office of Chongwadae.
					
					 It said that Kim, minister of Defense, illegally interfered in the past "presidential" election with red herring through the cyber command.
					
					 When this fact was disclosed, Kim said that the role of the cyber command included psychological warfare at home, it charged.
					
					 Noting that the psychological warfare is part of military actions against the other party, it held that Kim believes that the military may take a military action against their people.
					
					 Kim has pushed forward the offensive strategy for a preemptive strike at the north under the pretext of the "tailored deterrence strategy" and thus escalated military tensions on the Korean peninsula, it said, adding:
					
					 At a time when the peaceful settlement of the south-north relations presents itself as more important issue than ever before, the appointment of the guy insisting on the high-handed policy toward the north as chief of the security office shows that "confidence-building process" and "Dresden Declaration" are nothing but wordplays.
					
					 Park's appointment of the person from hard-line military as the chief of the security office cannot but be interpreted otherwise than her persistent stand that the security office is not a command for preventing disasters.
					
					 It demanded a cancellation of the appointment of Kim as chief of the security office of Chongwadae.
					
					 Meanwhile, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification launched a demo before Chongwadae in demand of the repeal of the appointment.

articles.title: 14th Anniversary of June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Marked by Koreans in Uzbekistan
articles.content:
14th Anniversary of June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Marked by Koreans in Uzbekistan
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Uzbekistan held a meeting on June 2 to mark the 14th anniversary of the publication of the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 Present there were the chairperson of the "Old Men" Association for Korean Cultural Tradition in Uzbekistan and officials of the association, the editor-in-chief of Thongil paper, the chairwoman of the women's association, heads of Korean art troupes and other compatriots. 
					
					 The charge d'affaires ad interim of the DPRK embassy in Uzbekistan and his embassy officials were present there on invitation.
					
					 Chairman Ju Yong Il said in his address that the north-south joint declaration provided by leader Kim Jong Il serves as important guidelines in the action to achieve the country's reunification.
					
					 Eye-opening events took place in the inter-Korean relations and the struggle for achieving the country's reunification in the course of implementing the joint declaration which reflected the spirit of By our nation itself, he noted, adding:
					
					 All Koreans in the June 15 era of reunification keenly realized in practice that the implementation of the declaration leads to the reunification of the country and the prosperity of the Korean nation.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations have reached a grave phase owing to outside forces' obstructions, he said, calling for turning out as one in the action to implement the declaration, bearing deep in mind the vitality of the joint declaration.
					
					 A bright prospect is in store for the country's reunification and the nation as they are under supreme leader Kim Jong Un, he noted.
					
					 Then, a performance was given by Korean artistes.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Poland
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Poland
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- A Polish committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was formed in Warsaw on May 29.
					 Slaboy January Guzowski, chairman of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 It decided to give wide publicity to the revolutionary career and feats of the President and the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche and arrange colorful political and cultural events.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Peru
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- A Peruvian committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Il Sung was formed in Lima on May 30.
					 Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to widely introduce the revolutionary career and feats of the President and organize colorful political and cultural events including remembrance meeting and film show on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in Russia
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" was brought out in booklet by the Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia on May 30.
					 The work, published on Jan. 29, Juche 92 (2003), clarifies the idea that the Songun-based revolutionary line and Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea is the powerful political mode of our era which was carried forward and developed on the basis of President Kim Il Sung's idea and line of attaching importance to arms and the scientific revolutionary line and political mode reflecting most correctly the requirements of the era and the revolution.

articles.title: British Organization Refers to Significance of Victory in Battles in Musan Area
articles.content:
British Organization Refers to Significance of Victory in Battles in Musan Area
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Britain-Korea Friendship Association released a statement on May 24 on the occasion of the 75th anniversary of the victory in the battles in the Musan area commanded by President Kim Il Sung.
					 The statement said that the advance into the homeland by the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and its shining victory of the battles in the Musan area under the outstanding leadership of Kim Il Sung were historic events of great significance in further developing the whole Korean revolution centering around the anti-Japanese armed struggle. They instilled the conviction of great victory into the minds of the oppressed people of the colonial countries who struggled against imperialism and dealt a heavy blow at international fascism, it noted.
					
					 The victory of the battles in the Musan area greatly encouraged all the Korean people to positively turn out in the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle with the faith that they are sure to win and Korea is sure to be liberated as long as there is the Korean People's Revolutionary Army led by him, the statement said.
					
					 It clearly demonstrated the truth and vitality of the Songun revolutionary idea that the revolutionary army guarantees the victory of the struggle of the popular masses for the independent cause and the prosperity of the country and nation, the statement noted.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un felicita al presidente sirio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un felicita al presidente sirio
Pyongyang, 5 de junio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 5 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad.
					El texto senala: 
					
					Le envio las calurosas felicitaciones a Vd. por haberse reelegido como Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria por el apoyo y confianza del pueblo sirio. 
					
					Las presentes elecciones sirven de un importante motivo en la lucha del pueblo sirio por rechazar los desafios de toda indole de los imperialistas y las fuerzas hostiles y defender la soberania y la seguridad del pais. 
					
					Le deseo a Vd. mayores exitos en sus responsabilidades por construir Siria independiente, pacifica y prospera.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre Granja Combinada Fruticola Taedonggang y otro
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre Granja Combinada Fruticola Taedonggang y otro
Pyongyang, 5 de junio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, junto con Ri Sol Ju recorrio la Granja Combinada Fruticola Taedonggang y el Combinado de Procesamiento de Frutas Taedonggang.
					Ante todo, el Mariscal estuvo en la Granja Combinada Fruticola Taedonggang.
					
					Aqui se hace mas fuerte la anoranza al gran General Kim Jong Il, dijo el Mariscal y recordo las palabras de una cancion llena de anoranza al Dirigente.
					
					Al presenciar en el mirador el campo de frutales copiosos y las viviendas e instalaciones de servicio publico enclavadas al pie del monte, dijo que alli es un paraiso socialista muy hermoso como un cuadro y aldea ideal del pueblo.
					
					Apunto que la granja se pudo construir magnificamente como base de produccion fruticola de gran envergadura gracias a la direccion del Dirigente quien dedico toda su abnegacion para ofrecer mas frutas a nuestro pueblo.
					
					El Mariscal presento las tareas para aumentar la produccion de frutas.
					
					Es enorme el area de huertas fruticolas formadas en la granja, senalo y agrego que a fin de aumentar decisivamente la produccion hay que incrementar sin cesar el rendimiento de cosecha por hectarea.
					
					Es necesario realizar en alto nivel la cientifizacion, la modernizacion y la sintetizacion de la produccion fruticola al elevar el papel de la granja y la rama de investigacion fruticola, asevero.
					
					Enfatizando que la granja es una importante base de produccion fruticola en el pais, ordeno a las ramas vinculadas suministrarle con suficiencia las maquinas, los productos agroquimicos, los abonos y otros equipos y materias necesarios a la granja.
					
					Pasando revista al Combinado de Procesamiento de Frutas Taedonggang dio las instrucciones que se presentan en mejorar la gestion.
					
					Recordando el dia en que se acompano al Dirigente en visitarlo, dijo que solo cuando se normalice en alto nivel la produccion se hara realidad el anhelo del Dirigente quien queria ofrecer mas a los habitantes las frutas procesadas.
					
					El combinado debe esforzarse activamente por mejorar de continuo el nivel de capacidad tecnica de los empleados, organizar bien la administracion de equipos y tecnologia, producir mucho las frutas procesadas de diversas especies y garantizar en el maximo nivel su calidad y la seguridad higienica.
					
					Expreso su esperanza y conviccion de que todos los empleados de la Granja Combinada Fruticola Taedonggang y del Combinado de Procesamiento de Frutas Taedonggang materializaran la ideologia del Partido y defenderan la politica del Partido.
					
					Le acompanaron Pak Pong Ju, Hwang Pyong So, Ri Jae Il y Choe Hui.

articles.title: MINREX aplaude constitucion del gobierno unido nacional de Palestina
articles.content:
MINREX aplaude constitucion del gobierno unido nacional de Palestina
Pyongyang, 5 de junio (ACNC) -- En relacion con la constitucion del gobierno unido nacional de Palestina, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dio el dia 5 la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC:
					El Movimiento de Liberacion Nacional (Fatah) y el Movimiento de Resistencia Islamica (Hamas), principales fuerzas politicas de Palestina, constituyeron el 2 de junio un gobierno unido nacional. 
					
					Aplaudimos el establecimiento del gobierno unido nacional de Palestina y apreciamos los esfuerzos de Fatah y Hamas por la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales. 
					
					Deseamos que el nuevo gobierno logre cuanto antes con las fuerzas unidas los derechos legitimos del pueblo palestino incluso la fundacion de un Estado independiente con Kuds como capital.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam desea prosperidad y bienestar al pueblo sueco
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam desea prosperidad y bienestar al pueblo sueco
Pyongyang, 5 de junio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia primero un mensaje de felicitacion al rey de Suecia, Carl Gustaf XVI, con motivo del Dia Nacional del pais nordico. 
					El remitente desea de todo corazon al pueblo sueco la prosperidad y el bienestar.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente de Malawi
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente de Malawi
Pyongyang, 5 de junio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 4 un mensaje de felicitacion al electo presidente de la Republica de Malawi, Arthur Peter Mutharika.
					En su misiva, el remitente desea al mandatario exitos en su trabajo para lograr la estabilidad y la prosperidad del pais y expresa su conviccion de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.

articles.title: ACNC comenta la "oleada anti-Norte" que se levanta en suelo surcoreano
articles.content:
ACNC comenta la "oleada anti-Norte" que se levanta en suelo surcoreano
Pyongyang, 5 de junio (ACNC) -- La banda de Park Geun-hye, caida en la crisis de gobernacion debido a la tragedia del buque Sewol, busca la salida en levantar la "oleada anti-Norte (de Corea)".
					Partiendo de su sucio complot politico de revertir la tendencia causada por la tragedia y calmar a la poblacion encolerizada, las autoridades titeres surcoreanas difunden el rumor de "ensayo nuclear de abril", "posibilidad de provocacion local", "infiltracion de drones norcoreanos", etc.
					
					Especialmente, publicaron el guion de la guerra de agresion al Norte titulado "estrategia militar de 5 etapas" e instigaron a los bribones del circulo militar a disparar obuses contra los buques de combate del Ejercito Popular de Corea, que cumplian la mision de guardia rutinaria en las aguas perifericas a las 5 islas del Mar Oeste de Corea, y las embarcaciones pesqueras de China.
					
					Los compinches conservadores como el "Partido Saenuri" cuestionan absurdamente a la RPDC chismeando que el "Norte abusa politicamente de la tragedia del barco Sewol" y "crea el conflicto entre personas fortaleciendo la agitacion sobre el Sur de Corea".
					
					Igualmente, se dedican a la invencion de la opinion publica necesaria para levantar la "oleada anti-Norte" incitando a los medios de prensa conservadores.
					
					Lejos de pedir disculpas y arrepentirse, los asesinos, que hundieron en el mar a cientos de personas incluyendo los alumnos menores de edad, tratan de eludir la responsabilidad y reprimen a los manifestantes tildando hasta a los familiares de las victimas de "fuerzas por-Norte".
					
					Llega al cielo la indignacion de los habitantes surcoreanos de distintos estratos que demandan la "retirada del poder de Park Geun-hye".
					
					La horda de Park, inquietada por la cada dia mas grave crisis de gobernacion, busca la salida en recrudecer el complot anti-RPDC y la campana conflictiva.
					
					La fabricacion de la "oleada anti-Norte" es un metodo que usan los titeres surcoreanos cada vez que se torna grave la crisis de gobernacion.
					
					Ya es tarde para salvar la nave naufraga de Park Geun-hye.

articles.title: Minju Joson publica articulo dedicado al Dia Mundial de Ambiente
articles.content:
Minju Joson publica articulo dedicado al Dia Mundial de Ambiente
Pyongyang, 5 de junio (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual publicado hoy en homenaje al Dia Mundial de Ambiente, el periodico Minju Joson presento las labores de proteccion ambiental en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Segun la politica medioambiental del gobierno que aprecia al ser humano como ente mas valioso del mundo, se ha instituido hace mucho tiempo en Corea la ley de proteccion ambiental y se exige cumplir los requisitos de la misma, senala el articulista y prosigue:
					
					Se toman las medidas estatales para proteger los bosques, prevenir la contaminacion de los rios y reducir la emision de gases con efectos de invernadero.
					
					Los visitantes extranjeros reconocen unanimemente el aspecto limpio y el aire puro de las ciudades coreanas.
					
					Por supuesto, quedan pendientes algunos problemas en la proteccion medioambiental.
					
					La proteccion del medioambiente de la Tierra y el desarrollo sostenible de la humanidad estan sujetos a los esfuerzos conjuntos de toda la especie humana. 
					
					El gobierno de la RPDC seguira cumpliendo en el futuro tambien con su obligacion nacional de proteger el ambiente de la Tierra en cooperacion con organizaciones internacionales.
